title: MySQLUCASE()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MySQLUCASE()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Convert the text to upper-case:
SELECT UCASE("SQL Tutorial is FUN!");

Definition and Usage
The UCASE() function converts a string to upper-case.
Note:
This function is equal to the
UPPER()
function.
Syntax
UCASE(
text
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
text
Required. The string to convert
Technical Details
Works in:
From MySQL 4.0
More Examples
Example
Convert the text in "CustomerName" to upper-case:
SELECT UCASE(CustomerName) AS UppercaseCustomerName
FROM Customers;

★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
SELECT UCASE(CustomerName) AS UppercaseCustomerName
FROM Customers;

summary: This tutorial covers MySQLUCASE()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MySQLUCASE()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MySQLUCASE()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
